tn.text: Yahweh tells Moses and Aaron what the people must do when someone is cleansed of a skin disease.
This refers to the day on which the priest declares the person to be ritually clean.

tn.ref: He must be brought to the priest
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "Someone must bring him to the priest" or "He must go to the priest" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses and Aaron what the people must do when someone is cleansed of a skin disease.

tn.ref: who is not able to afford
tn.text: Translate this so it is clear that the person does not have enough money to purchase a standard offering. AT: "who does not have enough money to buy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Here "you" refers to the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Translate this word in the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:13:47|13:47]].

tn.ref: in the land of your possession
tn.text: The word "possession" can be translated as a verb. AT: "in the land that you possess" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: so that nothing in the house will be made unclean
tn.text: Once the priest declared the house to be unclean, everything in the house became unclean, as well. This can be translated in active form. AT: "so that he does not need to declare anything left in the house to be unclean" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the house will be made unclean
tn.text: The house that Yahweh has stated is unfit for people to touch or live in is spoken of as if it were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: in the depressions in the wall's surface
tn.text: This means the priest is to determine whether mildew has gone deeper that just the surface of the walls.

tn.ref: in which the mildew has been found
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "in which they found the mildew" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
A place that is unfit for people to occupy or to be used for God's purposes is spoken of as if it were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "He" refers to the priest.

tn.ref: all the inside walls of the house to be scraped
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "that the owner scrapes all the inside walls" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the contaminated material that is scraped off
tn.text: This refers to the material with mildew on it. This can be translated in active form. AT: "the contaminated material that they scraped off" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
A place that is unfit for people to occupy or to be used for God's purposes is spoken of as if it were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This can be translated in active form. AT: "the stones that they removed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: they must use new clay to plaster the house
tn.text: "they must cover the stones with new clay"

This can be translated in active form. AT: "in the house after the owner takes away the stones, scrapes the walls, and covers the new stones with clay" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
A house that is unfit for people to occupy is spoken of as if it were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: The house must be torn down
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "They must tear the house down" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: The stones, timber, and all the plaster in the house must be carried away
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "They must carry away the stones, timber, and all the plaster in the house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: whoever goes into the house ... will be unclean
tn.text: A person whom other people may not touch and who is not acceptable for God's purposes because he has entered the house is spoken of as if the person were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"until sunset"
This can be translated in active form. AT: "the owner put new clay on the stones" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: he will pronounce the house clean
tn.text: A place that is fit for people to occupy is spoken of as if it were physically clean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: cedar wood, and scarlet yarn, and hyssop
tn.text: Translate these words in the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:14:03|14:4]].

tn.ref: the blood of the killed bird
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "the blood of the bird that he killed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
